comments.author: jk1700@gazeta.pl
comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/4.0b12pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110218 Firefox/4.0b12pre

Some addons can open a chrome page (chrome://) in an existing app tab

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Brief add on https://addons.mozilla.org/pl/firefox/addon/brief/
2. Open new tab app
3. Click the addon icon in the addon bar

Actual Results:  
Brief page (chrome://brief/content/brief.xul) is opened in the app tab


Expected Results:  
Brief page should open in a new tab

comments.creator: jk1700@gazeta.pl

comments.author: jk1700@gazeta.pl
comments.text:
Oops, STR is wrong, here is the correct one:

1. Install Brief add on https://addons.mozilla.org/pl/firefox/addon/brief/
2. Create an app tab
2. Subscribe to some rss, for example here are some handy ones you can play with http://webhosting.pl/feed/list - right after clicking the rss link switch to app tab
3. After the rss link is loaded the subscription dialog will appear (see screenshot, #1), click Subscribe
4. Wait for a while, rss entries will load and the notification about new entries will show (see screenshot, #2) - click on the notification

Brief page will open in the current app tab
comments.creator: jk1700@gazeta.pl
comments.raw_text:
Oops, STR is wrong, here is the correct one:

1. Install Brief add on https://addons.mozilla.org/pl/firefox/addon/brief/
2. Create an app tab
2. Subscribe to some rss, for example here are some handy ones you can play with http://webhosting.pl/feed/list - right after clicking the rss link switch to app tab
3. After the rss link is loaded the subscription dialog will appear (see screenshot, #1), click Subscribe
4. Wait for a while, rss entries will load and the notification about new entries will show (see screenshot, #2) - click on the notification

Brief page will open in the current app tab
